info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN APPOMATTOX...NORTHWESTERN CHARLOTTE...CAMPBELL...AND NORTH CENTRAL HALIFAX COUNTIES AND THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF LYNCHBURG THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gladys, or 9 miles south of Rustburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lynchburg... Appomattox... Brookneal... Phenix... Red House... Concord... and Rustburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
